title: If Mars had life before Earth did, would there be any realistic way of knowing it within our lifetimes? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. It is possible to know that. If a human or robotic explorer found a fossil, even a small one, we would know there had been life in Mars in the past. A fossil would be the most visually obvious evidence and the least likely to be doubted because of the possibility of contamination from Earth. The Curiosity Rover has been taking a close look at sedimentary rocks it encounters, which on Earth would be prime candidates for fossil finding, but so far… no fossils. :( Mars surface sedimentary rock via Mars Hand Lens Imager:
